content: amish star crochet lapghan approximate finished size 46 x 46 abbreviations beg - beginning chain - chain space - space slip_stitch - slip_stitch single_crochet - single_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet blo - back loop only rsc - reverse single_crochet here s the directions for the squares solid color granny finished square measures approximately 2 1/2 with size g hook chain 4 join with a slip_stitch to first chain to form a ring round 1 chain 3 2 double_crochet in ring chain 1 3 double_crochet in ring chain 1 three times join with slip_stitch to top of beg chain 3 round 2 chain 3 turn 2 double_crochet in first chain 1 space chain 1 3 double_crochet in same chain 1 space chain 1 3 double_crochet chain 1 3 double_crochet chain 1 in remaining 3 chain 1 sps join with slip_stitch to top of beg chain 3 finish off weave in loose ends bi-color granny finished square measures approximately 2 1/2 with size g hook chain 4 with main color join with a slip_stitch to first chain to form a ring round 1 chain 3 2 double_crochet in ring chain 1 3 double_crochet in ring drop main color but do not cut pickup second color yo draw through loop on hook 3 double_crochet in ring chain 1 3 double_crochet in ring chain 1 join with slip_stitch to top of beg chain 3 round 2 turn slip_stitch in first chain 1 space chain 3 2 double_crochet in same chain 1 space chain 1 3 double_crochet chain 1 3 double_crochet in next chain 1 space chain 1 3 double_crochet in next chain 1 space drop second color pick up main color again yo draw through loop on hook 3 double_crochet in same chain 1 space chain 1 3 double_crochet chain 1 3 double_crochet in next chain 1 space chain 1 3 double_crochet in last chain 1 space chain 1 join with slip_stitch to top of beg chain 3 finish off weave in loose ends materials needed model was stitched using i love this yarn available at all hobby lobby stores 18 oz peacock worsted weight yarn 7 oz light turquoise worsted weight yarn 27 oz black worsted weight yarn size g crochet hook tapestry needle assembly using tapestry needle and appropriate color yarn and whip stitching through back loops only assemble the squares using the diagram below as a reference border round 1 with peacock join with a slip_stitch to any stitch along edge chain 1 half_double_crochet in same st as join half_double_crochet evenly along all four edges of quilt working half_double_crochet chain 1 half_double_crochet in the corners chain 1 turn round 2 rsc in each half_double_crochet around all four edges working rsc chain 1 rsc in the corners finish off weave in loose ends every effort has been made to ensure the accuracy of these instructions we cannot be responsible for human error differences in individual stitching techniques or typographical errors
